pageContext.claim: “Twitter makes sure that Trending on Twitter is anything bad, Fake or not, about President Donald Trump. So obvious what they are doing. Being studied now!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is wrong to suggest Twitter employees are hunting for material that will make him look bad. He simply happens to make a lot of news, much of which he dislikes, and the Twitter algorithm will often collate the social media reactions into a "trend." "Trends are determined by an algorithm and, by default, are tailored for you based on who you follow, your interests, and your location. This algorithm identifies topics that are popular now, rather than topics that have been popular for a while or on a daily basis, to help you discover the hottest emerging topics of discussion on Twitter," according to Twitter.
